properties.name: Eiffel Tour
properties.description: Posted by NplParis, FranceThe Eiffel Tower was built for the International Exhibition of Paris in 1889.At 300 meters and 7,000 tons, it was the world\'s tallest building until 1930. The tower was almost torn down in 1909, but was saved because of its antenna. The antenna was used both for military and other purposes.The tower played an important role in capturing a notorius criminal during World War I, it gained a lot of importance to the French people that there was no more thought of tearing it down.

properties.name: Great Wall
properties.description: Posted by NplChinaThe Great Wall was originally built as a defensive fort against the three states: Yan, Zhao and Qin. The Great Wall has been through constant repairs since its construction. The wall began as seperate walls for different states when it was first built, and did not become the "Great" wall until the Qin Dynasty. He had the walls joined together in order to fend off the invasions from the Huns in the north. Now the Great Wall serves as a monument of the Chinese nation. Also a huge tourist attraction uniting people from all over the world.

properties.name: Lac Rose
properties.description: Posted by NplAfricaLac Rose is located in Senegal,Africa. Lac Rose is a pink lake where salt is collected and sold by the local\'s for profit.THe lake is around sixty-four feet deep and covers two acres in Africa. THe native people living around Lac Rose and in Africa speak French.This is so because of the large FRench rule that used to cover many parts of Africa.

properties.name: Liberty Bell
properties.description: Posted by NplPennsylvainiaThe Liberty bell has been ringing out from it\'s tower since July 8,1776. It was a commemorate of the 50 year anniversery of william penn\'s charter of privilages.The liberty bell is located in pennsylvania. The liberty bell\'s crack happened on Washington\'s B-Day in 1846. The liberty bell was cracked twice will being moved.The bell is now a historic artifact not a bell for ringing.

properties.name: MT. Rushmore
properties.description: Posted by NplSouth DakotaMount Rushmore Memorial is located in the southwest part of Rapid City. Each president represents a character trait. In the mountain 4 presidents portraits were carved out meant to represent different traits. For example;George Washington represents the struggle for independence, Thomas Jefferson the idea of government by the people. Abraham Lincoln for his ideas on equality and the permanent union of the states. Gutzon Borglum and a team of workers built this national monument.

properties.name: Stonehenge, England
properties.description: Posted by NplStonehenge is a prehistoric monument in the English county of Wiltshire. Archaeologists believe that the standing stones were put up around 2200 BC. and the surrounding circular area and ditch,have been dated to about 3100 BC. Many Archiologists have gone back and fourth on who set these historic stones. Archiologists believe there could have been a few groups of creators rather thatn just one.So still the stonehedge is a mystery to many.

properties.name: The Colosseum
properties.description: Posted by NplThe Roman Colosseum was originally known as the Flavian Amphitheatre. It was started in AD 72 by Emperor Vespasian. It was completed by his son, Titus in 80. The Colosseum is located just east of the Roman Forum and was built to seat thousands allowing 55,000 spectators, who were seated according to rank. Roman gladiators were usually slaves or prisoners of war/criminals. Most were men, but there were a few female gladiators. These combats were attended by almost everyone.Gladiators fought to the dealth until one winner stood alone.

properties.name: The Pentagon
properties.description: Posted by NplPentagon History began in 1941 when General Sommervell decided the United States War Department needed a temporary solution to its critical shortage of office space. The original site chosen for the Pentagon was a peice of land called Arlington Farms. The site was bordered by five roadways forming the pentagonal shaped building.The building was constructed out of reinforced concrete.The Pentagon is on 34 acres of land.

properties.name: The White House
properties.description: Posted by NplWashington, D.C.The White House is the official home and workplace of the President of the United States of America. Built between 1792 and 1800 of white-painted Aquia sandstone it has been the home of every U.S. President since John Adams. When Thomas Jefferson moved into the home in 1801 he decided to expanded the building outward. This renevation created two sections which were meant to conceal stables and allow more strage room. Over the years each president that has been in office has left his own mark on the white house by either painting a room or adding a theature or bowling alley.

properties.name: University of North Carolina
properties.description: Posted by NplChaplil Hill North CarolinaThe University of North Carolina is a historic college in North Carolina it was the first state university and is the largest in the state today. North Carolina thrives in medicine and law.UNC also has a 90% graduation rate. On the athletic side of UNC there are many amazing athletes that attend the school noticably in basketball where they have 4 national championships. UNC has also produced greats such as Micheal Jordan.
